## Summary
According to Cambodian officials, artillery was exchanged near the Preah Vihear border area on 12 January 2025. Thai spokespeople said their units responded to an unidentified incursion and denied firing first. Independent verification was not immediately available.

## Timeline
- **13:45 local (12 Jan 2025)** – Cambodian border officials report artillery fire near Preah Vihear.  
- **14:10 local (12 Jan 2025)** – Thai Ministry of Defense issues a statement claiming units responded defensively to an incursion.  
- **Later on 12 Jan 2025** – Both sides maintain conflicting accounts; no third-party confirmation yet.

## Actors Involved
- Royal Thai Army units near Preah Vihear
- Cambodian border forces stationed at the disputed area

## Evidence
1. [Reuters – Thai, Cambodian forces exchange fire near Preah Vihear](https://www.reuters.com/example) — Describes statements from Cambodian officials and notes the Thai response.  
2. [Khmer Times – Cambodian border forces report Thai artillery response](https://www.khmertimeskh.com/example) — Provides local commander quotes and reiterates the dispute.

## Confidence & Risk Notes
- **Confidence level:** DISPUTED — Multiple sources report the incident, but there are conflicting official accounts and no independent verification.  
- **High-risk factors:** War-crime allegations, named military units, and unresolved claims.  
- **Disputed details:** Thai officials deny initiating fire; Cambodian officials insist Thai artillery struck first.  
- **Moderator notes:** _Leave blank; moderators will record decisions here._

## Next Steps
- Seek independent corroboration (e.g., third-party observers or satellite imagery).  
- Update the entry if Thai or Cambodian authorities release additional evidence.  
- Downgrade or upgrade the confidence level once verification changes.
